intro: Hieracium subumbricola, commonly known as the shadowy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium subumbricola is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in temperate regions.
